alert.note: Alert for Madison; Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:56PM CDT until May 16 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Walker and Madison Counties. For the Bedias Creek...including Madisonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bedias Creek near Madisonville. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 19.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.5 feet on 01/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Bedias Creek Madisonvill 19.0 11.2 Sun 2 pm CDT 18.6 18.6 17.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
